text: Seasonal qualitative and quantitative differences in composition and antioxidant activities of male and female leaf essential oils of Pistacia atlantica were observed . The main components of male leaf essential oil were α - pinene / α - thujene , spathulenol and bicyclogermacrene . The major component of female leaf essential oil was δ - 3 - carene . The seasonal variation showed that most of the main components of the oils reached theirs highest values in September . The highest antioxidant capacity to scavenge free DPPH radicals was reached in the month of June for male oils and during the months of September - October for the female oils . The high reducing power for male oil was detected during the month of June and for the female oil was in August . The antioxidant activity of the female oil was almost ten times higher than ascorbic acid in the FRAP assay [ 81 ] .
